#summary Getting started, fast!
#labels Featured

= Prerequisites =

  * Install [http://haxe.org/download Haxe].
  * Install awe6 via haxelib tool, by running in the command prompt:

{{{
haxelib install awe6
}}}

= Windows Operating Systems =

  * Install [http://www.flashdevelop.org/wikidocs/index.php?title=Installation FlashDevelop].

=== Installing awe6 & !FlashDevelop project files & templates ===

To install latest awe6 via haxelib tool, run in the command prompt:
{{{
haxelib install awe6
}}}
To install !FlashDevelop project files and templates via haxelib tool, run in the command prompt:
{{{
haxelib run awe6 install
}}}

=== Starting a new project with awe6 with !FlashDevelop ===

  * Open !FlashDevelop.
  * _Project > New Project > Haxe > awe6 Project_
  * Hit F5 to compile & run.
  * Extend / modify as required.
   * Add new Scenes with _Project > Right Click > Add > awe6 > New Scene_
   * Add new Entities with _Project > Right Click > Add > awe6 > New Entity_

= Linux Operating Systems =

  * Follow the [http://www.joshuagranick.com/blog/2012/04/10/how-to-install-haxe-nme-and-monodevelop/ instructions] on this post
  * Download these [http://code.google.com/p/awe6/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2Fapp%2Fscripts%2Fbash scripts] and put somewhere pointed by the PATH environment (Ex. ~/bin or /usr/local/bin)
  * make them runnable by running:

{{{
chmod a+x create_awe6_*
}}}

=== Starting a new project with awe6 on Linux ===

  * `create_awe6_project projectname packagename author`
  * `create_awe6_scene scenename packagename author`
  * `create_awe6_entity entityname packagename author`
